questions.question: His grandfather is …………………………..
questions.description: Dead is an adjective. Died is a verb. Adjectives can be used as subject complements.

questions.question: He ………………………………. in
questions.description: The present perfect is not used with past time expressions.

questions.question: He objected …………………………… sitting there.
questions.description: A pronoun used to modify a gerund is usually in its possessive form.

questions.question: We are looking forward to …………………………….. you soon.
questions.description: We use an ing form after look forward to.

questions.question: Tell me where ………………………………..
questions.description: In indirect questions, the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: You had better ………………………………… another application.
questions.description: Had better is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: If you went there, you ………………………………… see him.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: If I ............................... this, I would be wrong.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.
